Photo REST API
  • Welcome to Photo REST API’s documentation!
  • View page source

Welcome to Photo REST API’s documentation!

Photo REST API main

This module contains the main FastAPI application.

It sets up the FastAPI app, configures middleware, includes routers, and handles exceptions.

Example:
To run the application, execute the following command:

uvicorn main:app –reload

Attributes:

app (FastAPI): The FastAPI application instance.

Photo REST API repository Comments

async src.repository.comments.add_comment(text: str, image_id: int, user: User, db: Session)

Adds a comment to an image.

Args:

text (str): The text of the comment.

image_id (int): The ID of the image.

user (User): The user who made the comment.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Comment: The newly created comment.

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, user: User, db: Session)

Deletes a comment from the database.

Args:

comment_id (int): The ID of the comment to be deleted.

user (User): The user who is attempting to delete the comment.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Comment: The deleted comment if successful, None otherwise.

async src.repository.comments.edit_comment(text: str, comment_id: int, user: User, db: Session)

Updates the text of a comment with the given comment_id.

Args:

text (str): The new text for the comment.

comment_id (int): The ID of the comment to be edited.

user (User): The user making the edit.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Comment: The updated comment object if successful, None otherwise.

async src.repository.comments.get_comments_by_image_id(image_id: int, db: Session)

Retrieves comments for a given image ID from the database.

Args:

image_id (int): The ID of the image.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

List[Comment]: A list of Comment objects representing the comments for the image.

Photo REST API repository Images

async src.repository.images.add_image(image_url: str, public_id: str, description: str, user: User, db: Session)

Adds an image to the repository.

Args:

image_url (str): The URL of the image.

public_id (str): The public ID of the image.

description (str): The description of the image.

user (User): The user who uploaded the image.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Image: The added image object.

async src.repository.images.delete_image(image_id: int, user: User, db: Session)

Deletes an image from the database and Cloudinary.

Args:

image_id (int): The ID of the image to be deleted.

user (User): The user who owns the image.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Image: The deleted image object, or None if the image does not exist.

async src.repository.images.edit_description(image_id: int, description: str, user: User, db: Session)

Updates the description of an image.

Args:

image_id (int): The ID of the image to be edited.

description (str): The new description for the image.

user (User): The user who is editing the image.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Image: The updated image object.

async src.repository.images.get_image(image_id: int, user: User, db: Session)

Retrieves an image from the database.

Args:

image_id (int): The ID of the image to retrieve.

user (User): The user object representing the owner of the image.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

Image: The image object if found, None otherwise.

async src.repository.images.get_images(user: User, db: Session)

Retrieves all images associated with a user.

Args:

user (User): The user object.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

List[Image]: A list of Image objects associated with the user.

Photo REST API repository Tags

async src.repository.tags.get_or_create_tag(db: Session, name: str)

Retrieves a tag from the database with the given name, or creates a new tag if it doesn’t exist.

Args:

db (Session): The database session.

name (str): The name of the tag.

Returns:

Tag: The retrieved or created tag.

Photo REST API repository Users

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None

Confirms the email address of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User

Creates a new user in the database.

Args:

body (UserModel): The user model containing the user’s information.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

User: The newly created user.

Raises:

Exception: If there is an error while retrieving the user’s avatar from Gravatar.

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User

Retrieves a user from the database based on the provided email.

Args:

email (str): The email of the user to retrieve.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

User: The user object if found, None otherwise.

src.repository.users.get_user_by_username(db: Session, username: str) → User

Retrieves a user from the database based on the provided username.

Args:

db (Session): The database session.

username (str): The username of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

User: The user object if found, None otherwise.

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Args:

email (str): The email of the user.

url (str): The new avatar URL.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

User: The updated user object.

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None

Updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Args:

user (User): The user object to update the token for.

token (str | None): The new refresh token. Pass None to remove the token.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.update_user(user_id: int, body: UserModel, db: Session) → User

Updates a user in the database.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user to be updated.

body (UserModel): The updated user data.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

User: The updated user object.

Photo REST API routes Auth

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Confirms the email associated with the given token.

Args:

token (str): The token used for email verification.

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing a message indicating the status of the email confirmation.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the user is not found or if the email is already confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Logs in a user and returns access and refresh tokens.

Args:

body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm): The request body containing the username and password.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Refreshes the access token and generates a new refresh token for the authenticated user.

Args:

credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials): The HTTP authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the provided refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Sends a confirmation email to the user’s email address.

Args:

body (RequestEmail): The request body containing the user’s email.

background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): The background tasks manager.

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the message indicating the status of the email confirmation request.

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Creates a new user account.

Args:

body (UserModel): The user data for creating a new account.

background_tasks (BackgroundTasks): The background tasks manager.

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the newly created user and a success message.

Raises:

HTTPException: If an account with the same email already exists.

Photo REST API routes Comments

async src.routes.comments.add_comment(request: Request, text: str, image_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Adds a comment to an image.

Args:

request (Request): The request object.

text (str): The text of the comment.

image_id (int): The ID of the image.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

The added comment.

async src.routes.comments.delete_comment(request: Request, comment_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Deletes a comment.

Args:

request (Request): The request object.

comment_id (int): The ID of the comment to be deleted.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the user is not an administrator or moderator.

Returns:

The result of the delete operation.

async src.routes.comments.edit_comment(request: Request, text: str, comment_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Edits a comment in the database.

Args:

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

text (str): The updated text of the comment.

comment_id (int): The ID of the comment to be edited.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the comment text is empty or contains only whitespace.

Returns:

The edited comment.

Photo REST API routes Images

async src.routes.images.add_image(request: Request, file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), description: str = '', db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Uploads an image and adds it to the database.

Args:

request (Request): The incoming request object.

file (UploadFile): The image file to be uploaded.

description (str, optional): The description of the image. Defaults to “”.

db: The database connection dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

dict: The added image information.

Raises:

HTTPException: If there is an error uploading the image or adding it to the database.

async src.routes.images.delete_image(request: Request, image_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Deletes an image from the database.

Args:

request (Request): The incoming request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image to be deleted.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

The deleted image.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the image is not found.

async src.routes.images.edit_description(request: Request, image_id: int, description: str, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Edits the description of an image.

Args:

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image to edit.

description (str): The new description for the image.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

The edited image.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the image is not found.

async src.routes.images.generate_qr_code(image_url: str, request: Request, user=Depends(get_current_user))

Generates a QR code for the given image URL.

Args:

image_url (str): The URL of the image to generate the QR code for.

request (Request): The incoming request object.

user: The current user (optional).

Returns:

Response: The response containing the generated QR code as content.

async src.routes.images.get_comments_by_image_id(request: Request, image_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Retrieves comments for a specific image by its ID.

Args:

request (Request): The incoming request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

List[Comment]: A list of comments associated with the image.

async src.routes.images.get_image(request: Request, image_id: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Retrieves an image with the specified image_id.

Args:

request (Request): The incoming request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image to retrieve.

db: The database dependency.

user: The user dependency.

Returns:

The retrieved image.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the image is not found.

async src.routes.images.get_images(request: Request, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Retrieves images for the current user.

Args:

request (Request): The incoming request object.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

List[Image]: A list of images belonging to the current user.

Photo REST API routes Transformations

async src.routes.transformations.add_filter(request: Request, image_id: int, filter: str, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Adds a filter to the specified image.

Args:

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image to add the filter to.

filter (str): The filter to be applied to the image.

db (Database): The database connection dependency.

user (User): The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The result of adding the filter to the image.

async src.routes.transformations.resize(request: Request, image_id: int, width: int, height: int, db=Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))

Resizes an image to the specified width and height.

Args:

request (Request): The HTTP request object.

image_id (int): The ID of the image to be resized.

width (int): The desired width of the resized image.

height (int): The desired height of the resized image.

db: The database dependency.

user: The current user dependency.

Returns:

The resized image.

Photo REST API routes Users

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))

Retrieves the details of the currently authenticated user.

Args:

current_user (User): The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

User: The details of the currently authenticated user.

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Updates the avatar of the current user.

Args:

file (UploadFile, optional): The file containing the new avatar image. Defaults to None.

current_user (User, optional): The current authenticated user. Defaults to None.

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to None.

Returns:

User: The updated user object.

Raises:

None

async src.routes.users.update_user(user_id: int, user_update: UserUpdate, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Updates the user with the specified user_id.

Args:

user_id (int): The ID of the user to update.

user_update (UserUpdate): The updated user data.

current_user (User, optional): The current authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException: If the current user does not have sufficient permissions.

Returns:

User: The updated user.

async src.routes.users.user_profile(username: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Retrieves the profile information of a user.

Args:

username (str): The username of the user.

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

dict: A dictionary containing the user’s profile information, including the user object, the number of images associated with the user, and the ID of the last image uploaded by the user.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the user is not found in the database.

Photo REST API services Auth

class src.services.auth.Auth

Bases: object

Class handling authentication-related operations such as password hashing, token generation, and user verification.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str

Creates an access token for the given data.

Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the access token.

expires_delta (float, optional): The expiration time in seconds for the access token. Defaults to None.

Returns:

str: The encoded access token.

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str

Creates a refresh token for the given data.

Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the refresh token.

expires_delta (Optional[float], optional): The expiration time in seconds. Defaults to None.

Returns:

str: The encoded refresh token.

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)

Decodes the given refresh token and returns the email associated with it.

Args:

refresh_token (str): The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

str: The email associated with the refresh token.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the refresh token has an invalid scope or if the credentials cannot be validated.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User

Retrieves the current authenticated user based on the provided token.

Args:

token (str): The authentication token.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

User: The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the credentials cannot be validated.

get_password_hash(password: str)

Returns the hashed version of the provided password.

Args:

password (str): The password to be hashed.

Returns:

str: The hashed password.

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>
pwd_context = <CryptContext>
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=redis,port=6379,db=0>>>
async update_user_role(new_role: str, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))

Updates the role of a user.

Args:

new_role (str): The new role to assign to the user.

token (str, optional): The authentication token. Defaults to Depends(oauth2_scheme).

db (Session, optional): The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

TokenData: The updated token data containing the user’s email and new role.

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)

Verifies if the plain password matches the hashed password.

Args:

plain_password (str): The plain password to be verified.

hashed_password (str): The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

bool: True if the plain password matches the hashed password, False otherwise.

Photo REST API services Emails

async src.services.emails.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)

Sends an email to the specified email address with a confirmation link.

Args:

email (str): The recipient’s email address.

username (str): The username associated with the email.

host (str): The host URL.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors: If there is an error connecting to the email server.

Photo REST API services Images

class src.services.images.ImageService

Bases: object

A class that provides image-related services such as uploading, resizing, adding filters, and generating QR codes.

async add_filter(image_id: str, filter: str, user: User, db: Session)

Apply a filter to an image and return the transformed URL.

Args:

image_id (str): The ID of the image to apply the filter to.

filter (str): The name of the filter to apply.

user (User): The user performing the operation.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

str: The URL of the transformed image.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the filter is invalid.

async generate_qr_code(image_url: str)

Generates a QR code image from the given image URL.

Args:

image_url (str): The URL of the image to be encoded in the QR code.

Returns:

bytes: The bytes representation of the generated QR code image in PNG format.

async resize_image(image_id: str, width: int, height: int, user: User, db: Session)

Resizes an image using Cloudinary API.

Args:

image_id (str): The ID of the image to be resized.

width (int): The desired width of the resized image.

height (int): The desired height of the resized image.

user (User): The user performing the resize operation.

db (Session): The database session.

Returns:

str: The URL of the resized image.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the width or height is invalid.

async upload_image(file)

Uploads an image to the cloud storage.

Args:

file: The file object representing the image to be uploaded.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the public ID and URL of the uploaded image.
